meanings.definition: Having greater length than usual or expected.
meanings.sent1: The snake was longer than the stick.
meanings.sent2: The river is longer than the stream.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tail seemed longer after it puffed up in fear.
meanings.sent4: The road to success may be longer than you think.
meanings.sent5: The shadow grew longer as the sun set.

meanings.definition: For a greater amount of time.
meanings.sent1: She waited longer for the bus than usual.
meanings.sent2: He stayed longer at the party than expected.
meanings.sent3: The cake took longer to bake than the recipe said.
meanings.sent4: Time seems to stretch longer when you're bored.
meanings.sent5: The days feel longer in winter than in summer.

meanings.definition: To a greater extent in time or space.
meanings.sent1: They decided to longer their vacation by a week.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to longer their business to other cities.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could longer the weekend by a day.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches longered towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The river longered through the valley, creating a beautiful landscape.
